item.text: In his old age Samuel appointed his sons as judges over Israel.

The <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st> of his <st data-num="01060" class="">firstborn</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="03100" class="">Joel</st>, and the <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st> of his <st data-num="04932" class="">second</st> son was <st data-num="029" class="">Abijah</st>. They were <st data-num="08199" class="">judges</st> in <st data-num="0884" class="">Beer Sheba</st>.
But his sons did not follow his ways. Instead, they made money dishonestly, accepted bribes, and perverted justice.
So all the elders of Israel gathered together and approached Samuel at Ramah.
They said to him, “Look, you are old, and your sons don’t follow your ways. So now appoint over us a king to lead us, just like all the other nations have.”
But this request displeased Samuel, for they said, “Give us a king to lead us.” So Samuel prayed to the Lord.
The Lord said to Samuel, “Do everything the people request of you. For it is not you that they have rejected, but it is me that they have rejected as their king.

<st data-num="03605" class="">Just</st> <st data-num="04639 0834">as</st> they have <st data-num="06213" class="">done</st><n id="1" /> from the <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> that I <st data-num="05927" class="">brought</st> them <st data-num="05927" class="">up</st> from <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, they have <st data-num="05800" class="">rejected</st> me and have <st data-num="05647" class="">served</st> <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st>. <st data-num="03651" class="">This is what</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> are <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">doing</st> to you.
So now do as they say. But you must warn them and make them aware of the policies of the king who will rule over them.”
So Samuel spoke all the Lord’s words to the people who were asking him for a king.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="02088" class="">Here</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">are</st> the <st data-num="04941" class="">policies</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> will <st data-num="04427" class="">rule</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> you: He will <st data-num="03947" class="">conscript</st> your <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> and <st data-num="07760" class="">put</st> them in his <st data-num="04818" class="">chariot forces</st> and in his <st data-num="06571" class="">cavalry</st>; they will <st data-num="07323" class="">run</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">in front of</st> his <st data-num="04818" class="">chariot</st>.

He will <st data-num="07760" class="">appoint</st> for himself <st data-num="08269" class="">leaders</st> of <st data-num="0505" class="">thousands</st> and <st data-num="08269" class="">leaders</st> of <st data-num="02572" class="">fifties</st>,<n id="1" /> as well as those who <st data-num="02790" class="">plow</st> his <st data-num="02758" class="">ground</st>, <st data-num="07114" class="">reap</st> his <st data-num="07105" class="">harvest</st>, and <st data-num="06213" class="">make</st> his <st data-num="03627" class="">weapons</st> of <st data-num="04421" class="">war</st> and his <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">equipment</st>.

He will <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> your <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st> to be <st data-num="07548" class="">ointment makers</st>, <st data-num="02879" class="">cooks</st>, and <st data-num="0644" class="">bakers</st>.

He will <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> your <st data-num="02896" class="">best</st> <st data-num="07704" class="">fields</st>, <st data-num="03754" class="">vineyards</st>, and <st data-num="02132" class="">olive groves</st>, and <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> them to his own <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>.

He will <st data-num="06237" class="">demand a tenth</st> of your <st data-num="02233" class="">seed</st> and of the produce of your <st data-num="03754" class="">vineyards</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> it to his <st data-num="05631" class="">administrators</st><n id="1" /> and his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>.

He will <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">male</st> and <st data-num="08198" class="">female</st> <st data-num="05650 08198">servants</st>, as well as your <st data-num="02896" class="">best</st> <st data-num="0970" class="">cattle</st> and your <st data-num="02543" class="">donkeys</st>, and <st data-num="06213" class="">assign</st> them for his own <st data-num="04399" class="">use</st>.

He will <st data-num="06237" class="">demand a tenth</st> of your <st data-num="06629" class="">flocks</st>, and you <st data-num="0859" class="">yourselves</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>.
In that day you will cry out because of your king whom you have chosen for yourselves, but the Lord won’t answer you in that day.”
But the people refused to heed Samuel’s warning. Instead they said, “No! There will be a king over us!
We will be like all the other nations. Our king will judge us and lead us and fight our battles.”
So Samuel listened to everything the people said and then reported it to the Lord.
The Lord said to Samuel, “Do as they say and install a king over them.” Then Samuel said to the men of Israel, “Each of you go back to his own city.”
